info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 7:42PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE... At 736 PM EST, a band of heavy snow showers was located along a line extending from Newington to near Temple in New Hampshire. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. This band of heavy snow showers will reduce visibility to one-half mile or less and produce wind gusts up to 35 mph for up to 30 minutes in any one location. Up to an inch of new snow accumulation is expected. Locations impacted include... Lowell, Lawrence, Haverhill, Peabody, Methuen, Leominster, Fitchburg, Billerica, Beverly, Woburn, Chelmsford, Andover, Lexington, Dracut, Tewksbury, Gloucester, North Andover, Danvers, Wakefield and Reading. Visibilities around one-half mile are occurring in this band of heavy snow, and could produce local whiteouts for a brief period of time. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to adverse driving situations. Consider delaying travel or pulling off on the side of the road until visibility improves.
